In a statement, the group voiced concern about “critical issues” that “remain unaddressed in this legislation,” including “the prospect of introducing systemic weaknesses that could put Australians’ data security at risk.” It also said the law’s provisions “potentially jeopardize the security of the apps and systems that millions of Australians use every day.”

The companies even hinted that they might exit the Australian market altogether in response to the bill, saying they would “assess the impact of this legislation and what it means for their operations in Australia.” In a separate statement, a broader tech coalition called the bill “deeply flawed, overly broad, and lacking in adequate independent oversight over the new authorities” and urged the legislature to “promptly address these flaws when it reconvenes.”
